SENT.plain: Addison's disease is an autoimmune process
However, Addison's disease associated with connective tissue diseases (CTD) is only occasionally reported

Here, we report six cases of Addison's disease secondary to a variety of CTD, which include systemic lupus erythematosus, Takayasu arteritis, systemic sclerosis, ankylosing spondylitis (AS) and antiphospholipid antibody syndrome
The association of Addison's disease with Takayasu arteritis and AS is reported for the first time
We also found high prevalence of hypothyroidism as concomitant autoimmune disorder
Our case series highlight the autoimmune features of Addison's disease
Therefore, we suggest considering adrenal dysfunction in patients with CTD
